revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Ready.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - We were satisfied with the results (Andreas Kaplony).
Submit - Made corrections to lines 3 and 4, so that they represent properly the APD version of the text.
Finalized - Ready. Trial for Arabic.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Fine. Pushing this through here for trial purposes.
Submit - Usama Gad entered the Arabic. I copied it over to this submission to pilot the entry of Arabic bilinguals.
Finalized - Ready.

Vote - AcceptText - I wrote to N. Gonis to ask for an opinion. He replied: "I see Cisca's point." He did not, however, have any books to hand to check the reading. L. Berkes has seen the reservations pointed out by F.A.J. Hoogendijk and has now proposed a different reading, which I was able to verify on the original.

Vote - AcceptText - Accept line break. Accept reading epsilon l. 9 (confirmed on published photo). I understand B's problem with l. 9 Îº(Î±)Ï„Î±, but do not agree with his solution of "carelessness": the same form is found in the parallel texts SB 5644, 5649, 5650, 5652, 5653, 5654. I would rather keep the reading of the edition. Accept the traces of rho and alpha.

I've added the line break before dodekaton in l12 and renumbered l12 to l13. as in SB.
I've added two minor corrections to l9: The end of the crossbar of the epsilon is still visible before pediadon, cf. the epsilon in the previous line (en onomati...). For e pediadon cf. http://papyri.info/search?DATE_MODE=LOOSE&DATE_START_TEXT=700&DATE_START_ERA=CE&DOCS_PER_PAGE=15&STRING1=%CF%80%CE%B5%CE%B4%CE%B9%CE%B1%CE%B4%CF%89%CE%BD&target1=TEXT&no_caps1=on&no_marks1=on.
At the end of l9, I don't like: Îº(Î±)Ï„á½° á¼Œ[Ï(Î±Î²Î±Ï‚)]. It would be very unusual to have the final alpha after the raised tau in Îº(Î±)Ï„á½° that indicates the abbreviation. I assume the scribe wrote two alphas out of carelessness. Furthermore, I see traces of a long vertical stroke after the second alpha that may well belong to a rho, cf. the rhos in Korra (l8). Above this stroke, I see a horizontal line that suggets a superscript alpha, cf. diakosia(s) in l11.
Both new readings have been checked against the original.Data Entry Error
rationalized languages in langUsage
changed editor names to URIs
Automatically updated revision description
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
updated markup for fractions (rend=tick)
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek; tagged num rend=fraction
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
Automated split from transcoder files
